review: It would be a great product BUT the remote is the weakest and most failure prone part and you cannot configure the device without it or configure it if you reset the roku.  We've had to reset all of our rokus a few times. I now have 3 of these rokus and ALL the remotes are by far the most unreliable remotes in 30 years of using 100s of remotes.  Button presses are very inconsistent.  Sometimes it decides that you are holding the arrow key down causing all kinds of issues.  The select key works less than 50% of the time and requires a repress.  Batteries get used up quickly even if the remote is hardly used.  (A smart phone roku app has saved us a few times as it was needed to stop automatic playback of each episode of a series.)  One day they will get an effective fast forward and rewind (30 second skip etc.) but for now, each channel does it's own thing and it's a crap shoot if you even get close to where you want to be; and slow slow slow slow.  We've had 3 devices all streaming HD at the same time without problems but then the broadband speed tests at 60 Mbps all the time.  Also have a chromcast to compare it too - which has no remote - but sometimes seems to give a much more convenient experience but with chromcast loading all the apps associated with each channel is a privacy nightmare as they all want access to all private info you have on your phone, as much as they can get.  Hence, we use the Rokus for now.  If you have to reset the roku, you need to re-setup every single account you have - Netflix, Hulu, HBO Go, whatever.

review: I purchased this along with the Roku 3.  I'm weaning myself off of cable which costs me a whopping $167/month, just for basic!  I'm using the stick in the bedroom and the Roku 3 in the living room.  I set up the stick and it took all of 5 min to setup, it probably wouldn't have taken that long, but I had to power down and power back up to get the remote to sync up.  I am extremely happy with this.  The speed is amazing and the choices of what to watch are endless.  I was like a kid in the candy shop, I didn't know where to begin.  I've purchased a CBS All Access, Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Amazon Prime accounts.  With all of that, plus the amortized cost of the Roku and my internet connection, I am saving $60 a month!  Not bad.  I would recommend this to anyone who is sick of watching their cable bill costs climb up and up and up for a large majority of stations I don't even watch!
author: Javagirl

It is a total waste of money and now I am searching for another streaming device that works well with Amazon Prime or I will need to cancel my Amazon Prime subscription.
